query: n-600 form fields required optional types descriptions supporting documents submission method authority deadlines instructions
answer: Form N-600 is for applying for a U.S. Certificate of Citizenship; required fields include personal details and citizenship proof; submit online or by mail.

results.title: [PDF] Form N-600, Instructions for Application for Certificate of Citizenship
results.content: NOTE: If you are under 18, are the child of a U.S. citizen parent, you regularly reside outside the United States, and you did not acquire U.S. citizenship at birth under INA sections 301 or 309, your U.S. citizen parent, U.S. citizen grandparent, or U.S. citizen legal guardian may need to file Form N-600K, Application for Citizenship and Issuance of Certificate Under Section 322, instead of Form N-600. Provide your U.S. citizen mother’s or father’s full legal name, date of birth, whether this parent is your mother or father, his or her country of birth, physical address, information about U.S. citizenship, and marital history in the spaces provided. Information About Military Service of U.S. Citizen Parents (Applicable only if you are claiming U.S. citizenship at the time of your birth outside the United States.) Item Numbers 1.

results.title: Form N-600, Explained - Boundless Immigration
results.content: Form N-600 is a form you will need if you were born outside the U.S and you need evidence of your U.S. citizenship.

results.title: N-600, Application for Certificate of Citizenship - USCIS
results.content: You have two options for filing your Form N-600 with USCIS: Online, using an electronic application form; or; By mail, using a paper

results.title: Immigration Form N-600 Application for Certificate of Citizenship
results.content: You should fill out Form N-600 Application for Certificate of Citizenship if you were born outside the US to one or more parents who are American citizens.
